snippet: Buried in the details are items of $14 million and $15 million that will also be for ‘certain school districts, public libraries and not-for-profit institutions.’
abstract: New York State's $150 billion budget earmarks $25 million that office of State Senate Majority Leader Dean Skelos says will go toward charter schools; allocation is obscured by generic language that critics say exemplifies opaque maneuverings of Albany lawmakers.
lead_paragraph: Buried in the details are items of $14 million and $15 million that will also be for ‘certain school districts, public libraries and not-for-profit institutions.’

headline.main: State Senate Leaders Says Additional $25 Million in Budget Will Aid Charter Schools
headline.print_headline: $25 Million in Budget Is Said to Be for Charters
